content.html: Whenever I get a notification for an iOS update I think it‚Äôs the last one my iPhone SE will get. With only 16 GB of storage I have no space for ‚Äúvarious security fixes‚Äù anymore but in 6 years this device has yet to let me down. I guess iOS 15.5 does justice to this excellent piece of hardware.

content.html:
Tumblr is the social network I have used the most in my life. Even though I stopped using it last year it will always have a special place for me. Almost a decade ago someone liked my post on Tumblr, we spoke for years in the platform and well, even though we lived in different continents, last month we moved in together.

I used Tumblr for the last time in August last year, I decided to delete my blog there because (at least in every connection I tried in Colombia) everything was unbearably slow and there was an ad like every second post in my Dashboard. I honestly thought Tumblr‚Äôs death was near, but around the same time Automattic took over and they‚Äôve been improving it ever since. First they added improved IndieWeb support and today Matt Mullenweg announced they‚Äôre adding ActivityPub support. This is HUGE.

Over 400 (500?) million users will be joining the Fediverse. Is Tumblr about to start the Open Web Revolution?

If this won‚Äôt do it, I have no idea what will then.
content.value: Tumblr is the social network I have used the most in my life. Even though I stopped using it last year it will always have a special place for me. I honestly thought Tumblr‚Äôs death was near, but around the same time Automattic took over and they‚Äôve been improving it ever since. First they added improved IndieWeb support and today Matt Mullenweg announced they‚Äôre adding ActivityPub support. This is HUGE.Over 400 (500?) million users will be joining the Fediverse. Is Tumblr about to start the Open Web Revolution?If this won‚Äôt do it, I have no idea what will then.

content.html: I was convinced the World Cup was starting today. As someone who has barely missed a cup match since Korea-Japan 2002 not knowing the starting date just feels weird, but what isn‚Äôt about a World Cup in November? It goes to show how unenthusiastic I am about Qatar 2022.

content.html: Inspired by FollowLists, I added a Following page on my website. It‚Äôs simple and rudimentary but serves its purposes: owning my Follows. Since it‚Äôs powered by the Mastodon API there‚Äôs room for integration with other services, but for the time being, it‚Äôll work just as a Blogroll.

Since it‚Äôs powered by the Mastodon API there‚Äôs room for integration with other services, but for the time being, it‚Äôll work just as a Blogroll.

content.html:
I‚Äôve been testing the waters of the Fediverse on and off since learning about the IndieWeb. I‚Äôve tried a couple of Mastodon instances, syndicating to Bridgy + Fed and more recently a @micro.blog account.

With the recent increase in activity thanks to pElon, I‚Äôve finally settled on a main ActivityPub profile: @kandr3s@kandr3s.co¬†

But until I can send ‚Äúfollowing activities" from GoBlog I signed up for an account @indieweb.social to follow all the interesting people I come across on the Fediverse and read them via RSS feed.

For the first time since joining I did an #introduction. I‚Äôm hoping to interact with more people on the open web and eventually move the whole operation to a single profile ü§û¬†the IndieWeb way.
content.value: I‚Äôve been testing the waters of the Fediverse on and off since learning about the IndieWeb. I‚Äôve tried a couple of Mastodon instances, syndicating to Bridgy + Fed and more recently a @micro.blog account.With the recent increase in activity thanks to pElon, I‚Äôve finally settled on a main ActivityPub profile: @kandr3s@kandr3s.co¬†But until I can send ‚Äúfollowing activities" from GoBlog I signed up for an account @indieweb.social to follow all the interesting people I come across on the Fediverse and read them via RSS feed.For the first time since joining I did an #introduction. I‚Äôm hoping to interact with more people on the open web and eventually move the whole operation to a single profile ü§û¬†the IndieWeb way.

content.html:
Ah, the joy that‚Äôs coming to this little, authentic Latino corner in Warsaw with take-out empanadas and Salsa music on the weekends. Macondo Bar Latino gets it.

Unlike all those insulting ‚Äúcolombian‚Äù restaurants around the world that take some inspiration from Escobar, they took the name from One Hundred Years of Solitude, a book a wise man once told me ‚Äúneeds to be read once every year.‚Äù Macondo is not just the fictional village on which the story takes place, it‚Äôs Colombia as imagined by author Gabriel Garc√≠a M√°rquez.

Seriously, if anyone sees this, please never go to any restaurant inspired by a narco. Anyone who thinks that‚Äôs creative or even okay can go to hell.

At Macondo Bar they have Bandeja Paisa (how do they even get such good pl√°tanos here in Poland? I want in üòÖ) I love the empanadas and I‚Äôm going for patacones next…
